summary:
We need to produce JSON with summary, business_intent, keywords list.

File is tests/run/function_self.py. It contains a class C with helper functions bound to instance, showing difference in __self__ attribute when accessed via instance vs class. Also several standalone functions: fused, nested, nested_in_fused, regular. They are simple helper functions.

Thus summary: This module defines a class with methods to illustrate how the __self__ attribute behaves differently when methods are accessed through an instance versus the class, along with several simple helper functions used in tests.

Business intent: Provide test utilities for examining function binding and __self__ behavior in Python, supporting unit tests that verify method binding semantics.

Keywords: class, method binding, __self__, instance, class, helper functions, test utilities, function self, Python introspection, bound method, unbound function.

Return JSON.

Let's craft.

Need to avoid listing function names verbatim. So not mention fused, nested, etc. Just refer to "simple helper functions". Also not list class name.

Ok.

Now produce JSON.

assistantfinal{{"summary": "The module supplies a class with simple helper methods to demonstrate the differing __self__ attribute values when methods are accessed via an instance versus directly from the class, together with a collection of straightforward helper functions used in test scenarios.", "business_intent": "Support unit tests that need to inspect and validate Python method binding behavior and the __self__ reference, providing reusable utilities for testing function and method introspection.", "keywords": ["method binding", "__self__", instance vs class, helper utilities, test support", "Python introspection", "bound method", "unbound function"]}}
